message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SY

The paper discusses Bayesian regularization in Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), which are commonly used in computer vision tasks such as image classification and object detection. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). However, the paper also discusses generalization in deep learning, which is a fundamental topic in machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of stochastic gradient descent, which is a common optimization algorithm in deep learning, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the probabilistic representation of hidden layers in CNNs, which is related to probabilistic graphical models, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the validation of the proposed theory on a synthetic dataset, which is related to control theory and system identification, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category.
